arm_group.description: 0.125% Bupivacaine HCL , Morphine sulphate 3 mg @ 3-5 ml/h

brief_summary.textblock:
we aim to compare the analgesic effect of 0.125% bupivacaine HCL, 0.125% bupivacaine HCL +
      Morphine sulphate 3 mg, 0.125% bupivacaine HCL + Fentanyl 100 micro gram both at rest and
      mobilization maneuvers.

clinical_study.brief_title: Postoperative Epidural Analgesia in Spine Fusion Surgery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  patients undergoing spine fusion surgery.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Drug addiction. Intraoperative dural tear. Uses of opioids drug for any reason in the
             previous 48 hours. Mental dysfunction. Spinal fusion for any infectious or malignant
             causes.

intervention.intervention_name: 0.125% Bupivacaine HCL , Morphine sulphate @ 3 mg 3-5 ml/h

clinical_study.official_title: Postoperative Epidural Analgesia in Spine Fusion Surgery

other_outcome.description: 3 serum samples for beta-endorphin will be taken 1st one preoperative base line , 2nd at VAS more than 3 at rest ,3rd when VAS less than 2 at rest

overall_official.last_name: Omnia A Abd El Raof, M.Sc.

primary_outcome.description: •	Pain will be assessed using the VAS ranging from "0" (no pain) to "10" (worst imaginable pain). Pain will be evaluated at rest, while coughing, and during mobilization. Maneuvers of particular clinical importance for postoperative mobilization (alone and with help) will be chosen: Turning in bed, standing in front of the bed and walking, and using the toilet without help. The time needed until the patient can first successfully perform these maneuvers will be documented.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

responsible_party.investigator_title: assistant lecturer of anesthesia and ICU, Assiut University

secondary_outcome.description: verbal rating score will be used (4 = very satisfied, 3 = satisfied, 2 = neutral, 1 = dissatisfied, and 0 = very dissatisfied).

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Caregiver, Outcomes Assessor), Primary Purpose: Treatment
